Articles.Content:
From the great minds behind (insert rocket name), I present you the Jupiter Mk.5! While it isn\'t the most efficient rocket in our lineup, it sure is the strongest.

It\'s first stage will get you out of the atmosphere, and the secondary will get you into orbit and beyond. This model has a MÃ¼nar mission pack attached on the top. The ship weights in at over 250 tons at launch, with the first stage weighing more than half of that. It can also be used for exo-solar missions.

(PS: Text under pictures.)

The first stage, containing 24 LV-T 30s firing at an estimated total of 124 seconds with 4,8 kilo newtons of thrust and will leave you at a height of approximately 45000 meters during a vertical launch.

Second stage firing. Please note that the gimbaled engines in the centre are also ignited, but are draining fuel from the outer tanks.

MÃ¼n transit stage, weighing in at below 20 tons.

Various stats:

Thank You.

I actually really enjoyed your craft, an its happily parked at 120KM Circular orbit, on my Persistance file.

I usually release/develop my craft too: Take the Biggest, most powerful craft with loads of fuel as possible ships...

Realistically it needs more RCS, may be just one more tank, even to the final return module, so the Lander stage or for High Atmo manuevering.

You really only need 3 RCS Thrusters, per cluster. An I\'d recommend moving 1 cluster to the Mun Lander stage.

It had ample power, leaving the deck. I was throttle\'d back too 33% after 30K as it kept accalerating like a scolded cat.

Extremely well put together with struts every where. (Consider safely removing some struts to save on weight, an parts that need Physics simulation)

Whats with the downward struts connected to the engines for?

PS: Consider pairing Four Fuel Tanks Per LV-T30 Engine, It makes a heavier/lazier craft. But allows a burn that commonly allows a craft to achieve a orbit without ever jettising first stage.
Where you get that Engineer plugin thingy? I need it so much!

-snip-

Whats with the downward struts connected to the engines for?

-snip-

those engines had a tendency of breaking of during launch, so those struts increased the launch success rate by 60%.
